dcterms:description: The TIRAMISU dataset consists of approximately 1.8 million programs generated through a code generator that creates random programs and sequences of code transformations. Each data point is a triplet of the form (program, a sequence of code transformations, measured speedup).
dcterms:title: TIRAMISU Dataset

dcterms:creator: A. Adams

F. Durand
J. Ragan-Kelley
dcterms:description: The Halide dataset is used for learning to optimize Halide programs with tree search and random programs. It includes a variety of programs and their corresponding performance metrics.
dcterms:title: Halide Dataset

dcterms:creator: Louis-Noel Pouchet
dcterms:description: The PolyBench dataset is a suite of benchmarks designed to evaluate the performance of compilers and optimizations. It includes a variety of computational patterns and algorithms.
dcterms:title: PolyBench Dataset
